cs2410.assn4.controller

Class ImageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs2410.assn4.controller.ImageController

  • public class ImageController
extends java.lang.Object
    Image Controller Utilizes the ImageList class to manage the imageList based on GUI inputs. Initializes the ImageList object when initialized with a fileName. Has methods to add and remove images, as well as get next and previous images. Includes Getter methods to get image info and status of ImageList. Saves the contents of ImageList to a .txt file when quit is called.
    Author:
    Steven Proctor

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds a new image to the imageList object given an image's URL and Title.
      javafx.scene.image.Image getCurrentImage()
      Returns an image from imageList given an index
      java.lang.String getCurrentTitle()
      Returns the title of an image, given an index
      javafx.scene.image.Image getNextImage()
      Increments currentImage by one, wrapping back to 0 if it exceeds the size of the imageList.
      javafx.scene.image.Image getPrevImage()
      Decrements currentImage by one, wrapping to the current size of imageList if currentImage is greater than the size of imageList.
      boolean isOneImage()
      Returns true if there is only one image added by the user.
      boolean noImage()
      Returns true if there are no images in the imageList, otherwise false.
      void quitProgram(java.lang.String fileName)
      Calls the writeFile() method of imageList to save the contents of imageList to a .txt file.
      javafx.scene.image.Image removeCurrentImage()
      Removes the image currently being viewed.
